[docs]class Cauchy1DFEformulation(FEformulation):
    '''
    Defines a user FE formulation
    '''

[docs]    def __init__(self):
        # Number of stress/deformation components
        self.p_nstr=2
        # Number of Gauss points
        self.ns=1

    

[docs]    def generalized_epsilon(self,v):
        """
        Set user's generalized deformation vector
        """
        gde=[
            Dx(v[0],0),  #gamma_11
            Dx(v[1],0)   #gamma_12
            ]
        return as_vector(gde)

    

[docs]    def create_element(self,cell):
        """
        Set desired element
        """
        # Defines a Lagrangian FE of degree 1 for the displacements
        element_disp=VectorElement("Lagrange",cell,degree=1,dim=2)
        return element_disp  



[docs]class left(SubDomain):

[docs]    def inside(self,x,on_boundary):
        return x[0] < 0.  and on_boundary



[docs]class right(SubDomain):

[docs]    def inside(self, x, on_boundary):
        return x[0] > 0. and on_boundary



[docs]class Imperfection(SubDomain):
    """
    Sets an imperfection
    """

[docs]    def inside(self, x, on_boundary):
        return between(x[0], (-0.1, 0.1))

           

[docs]class Cauchy1DFEproblem(UserFEproblem):
    """
    Defines a user FE problem for given FE formulation
    """

[docs]    def __init__(self,FEformulation):
        self.description="Example of 2D plane strain problem, Cauchy continuum"
        self.h = 1.
        super().__init__(FEformulation)  

    

[docs]    def set_general_properties(self):
        """
        Set here all the parameters of the problem, except material properties 
        """
        self.genprops=General_FEproblem_properties()
        # Number of state variables
        self.genprops.p_nsvars=38

    

[docs]    def create_mesh(self):
        """
        Set mesh and subdomains 
        """
        # Generate mesh
        #mesh=IntervalMesh(self.genprops.ny,-self.genprops.h/2.,self.genprops.h/2.)
        h=self.h
        ny=80
        mesh = IntervalMesh(ny,-h/2.,h/2.)
        #cd = CellFunction("size_t", mesh) #deprecated
        #print(mesh.topology().dim())
        cd=MeshFunction("size_t", mesh, mesh.topology().dim())
        #fd = FacetFunction("size_t", mesh) #deprecated
        fd=MeshFunction("size_t", mesh, mesh.topology().dim()-1)
        return mesh,cd,fd

    
        # Set imperfection
#     class Imperfection(SubDomain):
#         """
#         Sets an imperfection
#         """
#         def inside(self, x, on_boundary):
#             return between(x[0], (-0.1, 0.1))
        #return (between(x[0], (0.5, 0.7)) and between(x[0], (0.2, 1.0))) 
    

[docs]    def create_subdomains(self,mesh):
        """
        Create subdomains by marking regions
        """
        subdomains = MeshFunction("size_t", mesh, mesh.topology().dim())
        subdomains.set_all(0) #assigns material/props number 0 everywhere
#         imperfection=self.Imperfection()
        imperfection=Imperfection()
        imperfection.mark(subdomains, 1) #assigns material/props number 1 to the imperfection
        return subdomains

    

[docs]    def mark_boundaries(self,boundaries):
        """
        Mark left and right boundary points
        """
        boundaries.set_all(0)
        left0=left()
        left0.mark(boundaries,1)
        right0=right()
        right0.mark(boundaries,2)
        return

        

[docs]    def set_bcs(self):
        """
        Set boundary conditions for the user problem / could be replaced by external mesher, e.g. Abaqus, Gmsh...
        """
        h=self.h
        u_n=-0.00703095*h
        u_t=.1*h
        bcs=[
            [1,[0, [1],u_n/2.]],
            [1,[0, [0],0.]],
            [2,[0, [1],-u_n/2.]],
            [2,[0, [0],0.]], 
            ]
        return bcs

    

    

[docs]    def set_materials(self):
        """
        Create material objects and set material parameters
        """
        mats=[]
        # load material #1
        
        env_lib=ngeo_parameters.env_lib        #umat_lib='./libplast_Cauchy3D-DP.so'
        umat_lib_path= ngeo_parameters.umat_lib_path
        umat_lib = umat_lib_path+'/CAUCHY3D-DP/libplast_Cauchy3D-DP.so'
        import os 
        print(os.path.abspath(umat_lib))
        umat_id=1       # if many materials exist in the same library
        mat=UserMaterial(env_lib,umat_lib,umat_id)
        mat.props=self.set_material_1_properties(10000.,0.3,100.)
        #
        mats.append(mat)
        # load material #2
        
        env_lib=ngeo_parameters.env_lib        #umat_lib='./libplast_Cauchy3D-DP.so'
        umat_lib_path= ngeo_parameters.umat_lib_path
        umat_lib = umat_lib_path+'/CAUCHY3D/libplast_Cauchy3D.so'
 
        umat_id=1       # if many materials exist in the same library
        mat=UserMaterial(env_lib,umat_lib,umat_id)
        mat.props=self.set_material_1_properties(10000.,0.3,100.)
        #
        mats.append(mat)     
        # load material #3
        # ...
        return mats

    

[docs]    def set_material_1_properties(self,EE,nu,cc):
        """
        Sets material parameters
        """
        GG=EE/(2.*(1.+nu))
        KK=EE*GG/(3.*(3.*GG-EE))
        props=np.zeros(19)
        props[1-1]=KK
        props[2-1]=GG
        props[12-1]=cc
        props[15-1]=0.
        props[19-1]=0.
        props=props.astype("double")
        
        
#         GG=EE/(2.*(1.+nu))
#         KK=EE*GG/(3.*(3.*GG-EE))
#         props=np.array([KK,GG,0.,0.,0.,0.,0.,0.,0.,0.,0.,cc,0.,0.,0.,0.,0.,0.,0.,0.])
#         props=props.astype("double")
        return props

    

[docs]    def plot_me(self):
        # Plot solution
        import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
        #plt.ion()
        plt.xlabel("$x_1$")
        plt.ylabel("$v[0]$")
        font = {'size'   : 18}
        plt.rc('font', **font)
        Pavg=FunctionSpace(self.mesh,"DG",0)
        p=plot(self.feobj.usol[0])#, label='$u_2$')
        #plt.colorbar(p);
        
        plt.show()

    

[docs]    def give_me_solver_params(self):
        reference_data_path = ngeo_parameters.reference_data_path   
        import os
    #         nel=self.n
        self.slv.dtmax=10.
        self.slv.tmax=500.
    #         ninc=int(self.slv.tmax/self.slv.dtmax)
        filename='test1D_Cauchy'
    #         a=os.path.join(reference_data_path,filename+'.xdmf')
    #         self.saveto=a
#         self.saveto=reference_data_path+filename+'.xdmf'
#         self.saveto=''
        self.saveto="./Alex_shearing_ref_Cauchy_1D_2.xdmf"

        self.slv.nincmax=1000
        self.slv.convergence_tol=10**-4
        self.slv.nitermax = 20
        self.slv.removezerolines=False   


if __name__ == "__main__":        
    tic = time.perf_counter()
    My_FEformulation=Cauchy1DFEformulation()
    my_FEproblem=Cauchy1DFEproblem(My_FEformulation)
    my_FEproblem.give_me_solver_params()
